qas.question: When was Spielberg named the 'most influential celebrity in America'?
How much of the US believes Spielberg is influential?
How did Spielberg influence the public's behavior?

answers.text: many will think for a second before going into the water this summer

qas.question: Who did Forbes' list in 2014 as the most influential celebrity in the world?
In what year was E-Poll Market Research founded?
When did Gerry Philpott become president of E-Poll Market Research?
In what year did Forbes' publish their first Most Influential Celebrities list?

context: According to Forbes' Most Influential Celebrities <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>2014<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> list, <b4_0>Spielberg<b4_0/> was listed as the most influential celebrity in America. The annual list is conducted by E-Poll Market Research and it gave more than 6,600 celebrities on 46 different personality attributes a score representing "how that person is perceived as influencing the public, their peers, or both." Spielberg received a score of 47, meaning <a1_0>47%<a1_0/> of the US believes he is influential. Gerry Philpott, <a2_0>president of E-Poll Market Research<a2_0/>, supported Spielberg's score by stating, "If anyone doubts that Steven Spielberg has greatly influenced the public, think about how <a3_0>many will think for a second before going into the water this summer<a3_0/>."
